alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 9:35PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Orange and northwestern Osceola Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 935 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Celebration, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kissimmee, Bay Lake, Celebration, Intercession City, and Hunters Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
